formattedAddress: 141 E 48th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 141 E 48th St, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text:
This restaurant is one of my favorite Greek restaurants in NYC! üëçüòä
I first came here many years ago, just after it was opened, and I've never been disappointed! Yesterday I had lunch there with friends,  and we really enjoyed the cozy, festive atmosphere as well as the delicious and well prepared food. üëçüëç

The raw plate combo was truly outstanding      üòãüòãüòã ... and our main courses were delish with perfectly cooked fish üëçüòãüëç ... but lacking a bit in presentation!ü§î

Of the desserts we tasted, we liked the yogurt with the typical spoon sweets the best! üòã

The service was very friendly and professional ... but the prices are on the higher side ... reflecting the restaurant's location and the high quality of the food served! üòâ

originalText.text:
I came here 14 years ago with my family, a Monday night in 2009, so vibrant, such great food. So good, we came back 2 days later on a Wednesday and only got a table because our waiter remembered us from the previous night.

Went there tonight. Easy to get a table, in hindsight that should have been a sign. We were Totally deflated. I had the calamari , it would have been passable if it hadn‚Äôt been sitting under the warmer for 20 minutes. Chicken, blah‚Ä¶ same

The prices were crazy too, 30 bucks for a Greek salad???

Paid the bill and left the tip, and only after that gave some feedback to one of the senior staff.

Avra, truly hope you can get back some semblance of what you were.

originalText.text: Our family‚Äôs favorite New York restaurant. Whenever we have lunch or dinner or celebrate a birthday in Avra, it is always a great experience.. The stuff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The food is delicious, the  best Greek Salad in the city. And I love the ambience, festive and cozy, as if it is always Christmas there üòä.

originalText.text:
Although pricey for those who do not eat in this area often, the food is fresh and service was great. The lighting is great for a date or even just a simple dinner with a colleague.

Avra zucchini chips - crispy and seasoned just right
Octopus - slightly fishy but still tasty
Greek salad - tomatoes are extremely juicy
Beet salad - standard beet taste but the hummus really put the dish together
Cocktails - sweet

originalText.text:
ordered a vibrant green delight, got a chopped salad medley‚Äîmore lettuce varieties than a farmer's market. Even after saying "hold the cheese," surprise! Cheese crasher alert.

Then, COME THE SARDINES!! I swear, those little fish were saltier than the entire Atlantic Ocean. I took one bite, and my mouth turned into a salt lick.

And the zucchinis?
So, the zucchinis arrived oil-drenched, slippery enough to challenge a banana peel. But when I tried lifting them, they were more like floppy disks than chips.

.Plus, the warm dishes? Arrived colder than NY winter

Conclusion: I paid a Benjamin  for a front-row seat to the "Where Did My Appetite Go?" show.
